availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Thompson (Lawrence County, Ky, farmer; 2nd lieut.14th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Wesley Thompson and Mary Spencer Thompson. Married to Elizabeth Moore Thompson in Lawrence County on August 31, 1853. Father of Francis Thompson, Bluford Thompson, Thomas J. Thompson, Felix W. Thompson, and William H. Thompson. Student in Lawrence County in 1850. Farmer in Lawrence County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as third sergeant, first sergeant, and second lieutenant from December 10, 1861, to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 115A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 516.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Precinct 5, p. 229B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Lawrence County Marriages, p. 2 of 36 microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 280.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016221, Lawrence County Deaths, File #21546, p. 1753 of 3318 of microfilm.
